words.definition: To go from one place to another, often over a long distance.
sentences: We love to travel to new countries.
How often do you travel for work?
My dream is to travel around the world.

words.definition: A journey to a place and back again, especially for pleasure.
sentences: We are planning a trip to the beach.
Did you enjoy your trip?
The school trip was very exciting.

words.definition: An act of traveling from one place to another, usually over a long distance.
sentences: The train journey was long but beautiful.
They started their journey early in the morning.
Every journey begins with a single step.

words.definition: A period of time when you are not working or studying and can relax or travel.
sentences: We are going on vacation next month.
Where did you spend your last vacation?
I need a long vacation to rest.

words.definition: A day of celebration or rest, or a period of time when you do not work.
sentences: Happy holidays to everyone!
We spent our summer holiday at the lake.
Many people travel during public holidays.

words.definition: A person who is traveling or visiting a place for pleasure.
sentences: Many tourists visit Paris every year.
The city welcomes all tourists.
I feel like a tourist in my own town sometimes.

words.definition: An official document that allows you to travel to foreign countries.
sentences: Don't forget your passport when you travel abroad.
My passport expires next year.
You need a valid passport to enter the country.

words.definition: An official mark put in your passport that allows you to enter or leave a country.
sentences: I need a visa to visit that country.
Applying for a visa can take time.
Some countries offer visa-free travel.

words.definition: Bags and suitcases that you take with you when you travel.
sentences: Please put your luggage in the trunk.
My luggage is too heavy.
We collected our luggage from the carousel.

words.definition: A rectangular case with a handle, used for carrying clothes and other belongings when traveling.
sentences: I packed my clothes in a large suitcase.
He carried his suitcase up the stairs.
My suitcase has wheels, which is very helpful.

words.definition: A bag carried on the back, used for carrying things, especially by hikers or students.
sentences: She carried her books in a backpack.
He packed his backpack for the hike.
A small backpack is good for a day trip.

words.definition: A piece of paper or electronic document that shows you have paid for a journey or event.
sentences: I bought a train ticket to the city.
Do you have your concert ticket?
Show your ticket at the entrance.

words.definition: A document that allows you to get on a plane or ship.
sentences: You need your boarding pass to enter the gate.
I printed my boarding pass at home.
Show your boarding pass and passport.

words.definition: A place where airplanes take off and land, with buildings for passengers.
sentences: We arrived at the airport two hours early.
The airport was very busy.
My flight departs from Terminal 2 at the airport.

words.definition: A vehicle with wings and engines that flies through the air.
sentences: The airplane took off smoothly.
I love watching airplanes fly.
We traveled by airplane to London.

words.definition: A journey made by an airplane.
sentences: Our flight was delayed due to bad weather.
The flight to New York takes six hours.
I hope to have a comfortable flight.

words.definition: A person who operates the controls of an aircraft.
sentences: The pilot announced our arrival.
My uncle is a pilot.
The pilot landed the plane safely.

words.definition: A person who serves passengers on an aircraft.
sentences: The flight attendant offered us drinks.
She wants to become a flight attendant.
Flight attendants ensure passenger safety.

words.definition: A specific area in an airport where passengers wait to board a flight.
sentences: Our flight is departing from Gate 10.
Please proceed to your boarding gate.
The gate number was changed at the last minute.

words.definition: A building at an airport where passengers arrive and depart.
sentences: We arrived at Terminal 3.
Which terminal does your airline use?
The new terminal is very modern.

words.definition: The act of registering your arrival at a hotel or airport.
sentences: We need to check-in an hour before the flight.
The check-in desk is on the right.
Online check-in saves time.

words.definition: The act of leaving a place.
sentences: The departure time is 9:00 AM.
We waved goodbye at her departure.
Check the departure board for updates.

words.definition: The act of reaching a place.
sentences: Her arrival was delayed by traffic.
We waited for their arrival at the station.
The arrival gate is usually crowded.

words.definition: The place at an airport or border where your bags are checked for illegal goods.
sentences: We had to go through customs after landing.
Do you have anything to declare at customs?
Customs officers check passports.

words.definition: The process of entering a country to live or work, or the place where officials check your right to enter.
sentences: We passed through immigration quickly.
The immigration officer checked my visa.
Long lines at immigration are common.

words.definition: A flight or train that allows you to continue your journey after arriving on another.
sentences: I missed my connection flight.
Is there a direct connection to the city center?
Our connection time is very short.

words.definition: A form of transport that runs on railway tracks.
sentences: We took the train to the next town.
The train station is nearby.
High-speed trains are very fast.

words.definition: A place where trains or buses stop for passengers to get on or off.
sentences: Meet me at the train station.
The bus station is very crowded.
Is this the last station?

words.definition: A large road vehicle that carries passengers, usually along a fixed route.
sentences: I take the bus to school every day.
The bus stop is just around the corner.
The bus was full of tourists.

words.definition: A road vehicle with an engine, usually with four wheels, that can carry a small number of passengers.
sentences: We rented a car for our trip.
My new car is blue.
Driving a car gives you freedom.

words.definition: A car with a driver that you pay to take you somewhere.
sentences: Let's take a taxi to the hotel.
The taxi driver was very friendly.
Can you call a taxi for me?

words.definition: An underground railway system in a city.
sentences: The subway is a fast way to travel in the city.
Take the subway to the museum.
The subway station is always busy.

words.definition: A drawing of an area, showing roads, rivers, towns, etc.
sentences: We used a map to find our way.
Can you show me on the map?
I always carry a map when I travel.

words.definition: A person who shows the way to others, especially on a tour.
sentences: Our tour guide was very knowledgeable.
The guide led us through the forest.
We hired a local guide for the city tour.

words.definition: A building where travelers can pay to stay and eat meals.
sentences: We booked a nice hotel by the beach.
The hotel room was very comfortable.
Is there a hotel near the airport?

words.definition: A cheap place to stay, especially for young travelers, with shared rooms.
sentences: Many backpackers stay in hostels.
The hostel had a common kitchen.
Hostels are good for meeting new people.

words.definition: A place where many people go for holidays, usually with hotels, restaurants, and entertainment.
sentences: We stayed at a luxury resort in the mountains.
This resort has a large swimming pool.
The family-friendly resort offers many activities.

words.definition: A place where you can live or stay.
sentences: We found good accommodation near the city center.
The price includes flight and accommodation.
Finding suitable accommodation can be tricky.

words.definition: An arrangement to have a hotel room, a table at a restaurant, etc., kept for you.
sentences: Do you have a reservation?
I made a reservation for two nights.
It's wise to make a reservation during peak season.

words.definition: To arrange to use or have something at a particular time in the future.
sentences: We need to book our flights soon.
I booked a table at the restaurant.
You can book tickets online.

words.definition: To put things into a bag or suitcase to take them with you.
sentences: I need to pack my clothes for the trip.
Did you pack enough socks?
She helped me pack my suitcase.

words.definition: To take things out of a bag or suitcase.
sentences: It's time to unpack our bags.
He unpacked his belongings and put them away.
I always unpack as soon as I arrive.

words.definition: The activity of visiting famous or interesting places, especially as a tourist.
sentences: We spent the day sightseeing in the city.
Sightseeing is my favorite part of traveling.
The bus tour offers great sightseeing opportunities.

words.definition: To travel around a place in order to find out what is there.
sentences: Let's explore the old town.
I love to explore new cultures.
We explored the forest for hours.

words.definition: An area of sand or stones next to the sea or a lake.
sentences: Let's go to the beach tomorrow.
The kids played on the beach.
The beach was very crowded.

words.definition: A very high hill, often with a pointed top.
sentences: We hiked up the mountain.
The view from the mountain top was amazing.
Many people enjoy skiing in the mountains.

words.definition: A large and important town.
sentences: New York is a very big city.
We are visiting a new city next week.
The city lights were beautiful at night.

words.definition: An area of land that has its own government and is known by a specific name.
sentences: Which country are you from?
I want to visit every country in Europe.
Traveling to a new country is exciting.

words.definition: The most important city or town of a country or region, usually where the government is.
sentences: Paris is the capital of France.
We visited the capital city last summer.
The capital is known for its history.

words.definition: The system of money used in a particular country.
sentences: What is the local currency?
I need to exchange my currency.
The currency exchange rate changes daily.

words.definition: Money in the form of coins or banknotes.
sentences: Do you have any cash on you?
I prefer to pay with cash.
Many small shops only accept cash.

words.definition: A small plastic card that allows you to buy things and pay for them later.
sentences: Can I pay with a credit card?
Always keep your credit card safe.
Some places don't accept credit cards.

words.definition: A machine that allows you to get money from your bank account using a card.
sentences: Is there an ATM nearby?
I need to withdraw cash from the ATM.
The ATM is out of order.

words.definition: Something you buy or keep to remind you of a place you visited.
sentences: I bought a souvenir for my mom.
This T-shirt is a souvenir from Rome.
Many shops sell local souvenirs.

words.definition: A place where you can buy and eat a meal.
sentences: We had dinner at a nice restaurant.
This restaurant serves delicious local food.
Is there a good restaurant nearby?

words.definition: A small restaurant where you can buy drinks, especially coffee, and simple meals.
sentences: Let's meet at the cafe for coffee.
The cafe has free Wi-Fi.
I like to read in a quiet cafe.

words.definition: A list of the food and drinks that are available in a restaurant.
sentences: Can I see the menu, please?
The menu has many options.
What's on the special menu today?

words.definition: A person who serves food and drinks in a restaurant.
sentences: The waiter took our order.
The waitress was very polite.
We waited for the waiter to bring the bill.

words.definition: A piece of paper that shows how much money you owe for food, drinks, or services.
sentences: Can we have the bill, please?
The bill came to fifty dollars.
Don't forget to pay the bill.

words.definition: A small amount of money given to someone who has provided a service, in addition to the payment.
sentences: It's polite to leave a tip for good service.
How much should we tip the driver?
The waiter received a generous tip.

words.definition: A shop that sells items that remind you of a place you visited.
sentences: We bought gifts at the souvenir shop.
The souvenir shop was full of interesting things.
Let's visit the souvenir shop before we leave.

words.definition: A public place where people buy and sell goods, often outdoors.
sentences: The local market sells fresh fruits.
We bought some crafts at the market.
The night market is very lively.

words.definition: Relating to the particular area or neighborhood where you are.
sentences: We tried the local food.
Ask a local for directions.
The local people were very welcoming.

words.definition: From or relating to a country that is not your own.
sentences: I love to learn foreign languages.
She is studying abroad in a foreign country.
Many foreign visitors come here.

words.definition: The customs, arts, social institutions, and achievements of a particular nation, people, or group.
sentences: We learned about the local culture.
Travel helps you experience new cultures.
Food is an important part of a country's culture.

words.definition: The system of communication used by a particular community or country.
sentences: Do you speak the local language?
Learning a new language is fun.
English is a widely spoken language.

words.definition: A small book containing common phrases in a foreign language.
sentences: I bought a phrasebook for my trip.
A phrasebook can be very useful.
She used a phrasebook to ask for directions.

words.definition: To change words from one language into another.
sentences: Can you translate this for me?
I use an app to translate.
It's hard to translate poetry well.

words.definition: Instructions about how to get from one place to another.
sentences: Can you give me directions to the station?
We got lost because we didn't follow the directions.
The map provides clear directions.

words.definition: The direction that is opposite to the south.
sentences: The city is located to the north.
Birds fly north in the spring.
The compass needle points north.

words.definition: The direction that is opposite to the north.
sentences: We drove south for two hours.
The warmest part of the country is in the south.
The wind is blowing from the south.

words.definition: The direction where the sun rises.
sentences: The sun rises in the east.
Go east for about a mile.
Japan is an East Asian country.

words.definition: The direction where the sun sets.
sentences: The sun sets in the west.
The road goes west.
California is on the west coast.

words.definition: On or to the side of your body that is not your right side.
sentences: Turn left at the next corner.
Keep to the left side of the road.
My house is on the left.

words.definition: On or to the side of your body that is not your left side.
sentences: Turn right after the bridge.
The store is on your right.
He writes with his right hand.

words.definition: In a direct line; not curving or bending.
sentences: Go straight ahead for two blocks.
The road is straight and flat.
Walk straight until you see the park.

words.definition: In or to a foreign country.
sentences: She decided to study abroad.
Have you ever lived abroad?
Many people travel abroad for holidays.

words.definition: For the duration of a night; during the night.
sentences: We took an overnight train.
The package arrived overnight.
We stayed overnight at a friend's house.

words.definition: A plan of a journey, including the route and places you will visit.
sentences: Our itinerary includes visits to three cities.
The travel agent helped us plan our itinerary.
Stick to the itinerary to save time.

words.definition: The place to which someone or something is going or being sent.
sentences: Our final destination is Rome.
What is your dream travel destination?
We arrived safely at our destination.

words.definition: The area in an airport where passengers wait before boarding their flight.
sentences: We waited in the departure lounge.
The departure lounge was very crowded.
You can find shops in the departure lounge.

words.definition: The area in an airport where passengers collect their luggage after a flight.
sentences: Go to baggage claim to get your suitcase.
There's a long wait at baggage claim.
My bag was the last one on the baggage claim carousel.

words.definition: A small bag or suitcase that you are allowed to take onto an airplane with you.
sentences: I only brought a small carry-on bag.
Make sure your carry-on fits in the overhead bin.
Liquids in carry-on bags have restrictions.

words.definition: A seat next to a window, especially on a plane or train.
sentences: I prefer a window seat on flights.
Do you want an aisle or a window seat?
The window seat offers great views.

words.definition: A seat next to the passage between rows of seats, especially on a plane or train.
sentences: He always chooses an aisle seat.
An aisle seat makes it easy to get up.
I prefer an aisle seat for long flights.

words.definition: A storage compartment above the seats in an airplane.
sentences: Put your carry-on in the overhead bin.
The overhead bin was full.
Please close the overhead bin securely.

words.definition: A strap worn in a vehicle or aircraft to hold you in your seat in case of an accident.
sentences: Please fasten your seatbelt.
Always wear your seatbelt for safety.
The seatbelt sign is now off.

words.definition: When an aircraft leaves the ground and begins to fly.
sentences: The plane will take off in five minutes.
We watched the planes take off.
The take-off was very smooth.

words.definition: When an aircraft returns to the ground after flying.
sentences: The plane will land soon.
We landed safely in New York.
The pilot prepared to land the aircraft.

words.definition: A holiday on a ship, sailing from place to place.
sentences: They went on a cruise to the Caribbean.
A cruise is a relaxing way to travel.
The cruise ship was huge.

words.definition: A large boat used for traveling long distances, especially across the sea.
sentences: The ship sailed across the ocean.
We saw a big ship in the harbor.
The cruise ship has many restaurants.

words.definition: A boat that transports people and vehicles across a body of water.
sentences: We took the ferry to the island.
The ferry ride was very pleasant.
The ferry runs every hour.

words.definition: A town or city with a harbor where ships load and unload.
sentences: The ship arrived at the port.
Many goods are imported through this port.
The port was busy with activity.

words.definition: A place on the coast where ships can shelter.
sentences: The boats were anchored in the harbor.
The harbor is full of fishing boats.
We walked along the harbor at sunset.

words.definition: Goods that you can buy without paying tax, especially at airports or on planes.
sentences: I bought some perfume at the duty-free shop.
Duty-free items are often cheaper.
The airport has a large duty-free area.

words.definition: The value of one country's money compared to another country's money.
sentences: What's the current exchange rate for dollars to euros?
The exchange rate is favorable today.
Check the exchange rate before you travel.

words.definition: A book that gives information about a place, for tourists.
sentences: We used a guidebook to find the best restaurants.
This guidebook has a map of the city.
A good guidebook is essential for planning a trip.

words.definition: A journey through a place, often with a guide, to see its sights.
sentences: We took a guided tour of the castle.
The bus tour lasted three hours.
They offer walking tours of the historic district.

words.definition: A short journey or trip, especially one engaged in as a leisure activity.
sentences: We went on an excursion to the nearby island.
The school organized an excursion to the museum.
The boat offers daily excursions.

words.definition: An exciting and sometimes dangerous experience.
sentences: Traveling is a great adventure.
They went on an adventure into the jungle.
Life is an adventure, enjoy the ride.

words.definition: Knowledge or skill gained over time, or an event that affects you.
sentences: Traveling offers many new experiences.
It was an unforgettable experience.
I want to experience local traditions.

words.definition: A cover or case for holding a passport and other travel documents.
sentences: Keep your passport in a passport holder.
She bought a new leather passport holder.
A passport holder helps keep documents organized.

words.definition: Insurance that protects you against financial risks and losses while traveling.
sentences: It's wise to buy travel insurance.
Travel insurance covers medical emergencies abroad.
Read the terms of your travel insurance carefully.

words.definition: An injection that protects you against a disease.
sentences: Some countries require specific vaccinations.
Get your vaccinations before traveling.
The doctor advised on necessary vaccinations.

words.definition: A feeling of tiredness and confusion caused by traveling quickly across different time zones.
sentences: I suffered from bad jet lag after my flight.
How do you deal with jet lag?
Try to adjust your sleep schedule to avoid jet lag.

words.definition: A situation in which something happens later than it should.
sentences: Our flight had a two-hour delay.
Traffic caused a delay in our journey.
We hope there are no more delays.

words.definition: To decide that something planned will not happen.
sentences: They had to cancel their trip.
The flight was canceled due to bad weather.
We had to cancel our hotel reservation.

words.definition: A sum of money that is returned to you, for example, because you have paid too much or because you returned goods.
sentences: I asked for a refund for the canceled ticket.
Can I get a refund if I return this?
The company offered a full refund.

words.definition: The area at an airport where you leave your checked luggage.
sentences: Go to the baggage drop after checking in online.
The baggage drop queue was very long.
You can use the self-service baggage drop.

words.definition: An examination of people or things to ensure they are not dangerous or illegal.
sentences: Everyone must pass through the security check.
The security check at the airport is strict.
Be prepared for a thorough security check.

words.definition: The gate from which passengers board an aircraft.
sentences: Please proceed to boarding gate B2.
The announcement for boarding gate was made.
We waited near the boarding gate.

words.definition: The area in an airport where passengers arrive.
sentences: We met them in the arrivals hall.
The arrivals hall was crowded with welcoming families.
You can find car rental desks in the arrivals hall.

words.definition: A place where you can get information, especially in a public building.
sentences: Ask at the information desk for help.
The information desk is open 24 hours.
They directed me to the information desk.

words.definition: A place where lost items are kept until they are claimed by their owners.
sentences: I reported my lost wallet at the lost and found.
Check the lost and found for your umbrella.
The airport has a lost and found office.

words.definition: A long journey by car.
sentences: We are planning a road trip across the country.
Road trips are fun with friends.
Our road trip took us through beautiful scenery.

words.definition: A place beside a road where drivers can stop to rest, eat, or use restrooms.
sentences: Let's take a break at the next rest stop.
The rest stop had a small cafe.
We stopped at a rest stop to stretch our legs.

words.definition: A place where people can set up tents or park caravans for camping.
sentences: We found a nice campsite by the lake.
The campsite has facilities for cooking.
We booked a campsite for the weekend.

words.definition: A warm bag that you sleep in when camping.
sentences: I brought my sleeping bag for the camping trip.
A good sleeping bag keeps you warm.
Roll up your sleeping bag before leaving.

words.definition: A fire made outdoors, typically at a campsite.
sentences: We sat around the campfire and told stories.
Be careful with the campfire.
We roasted marshmallows over the campfire.

words.definition: The activity of walking long distances in the countryside.
sentences: We went hiking in the mountains.
Hiking is a great way to see nature.
Wear comfortable shoes for hiking.

words.definition: A path or track made across open country or through woods.
sentences: We followed the hiking trail.
The trail led us to a beautiful waterfall.
Stay on the marked trail for safety.

words.definition: What you can see from a particular place.
sentences: The hotel room has a great view of the ocean.
The view from the top of the hill was stunning.
We stopped to admire the view.

words.definition: Goods that you can buy without paying tax, especially at airports or on planes.
sentences: I bought some perfume at the duty-free shop.
Duty-free items are often cheaper.
The airport has a large duty-free area.

words.definition: The style of cooking and food typical of a particular region or country.
sentences: We tried the local cuisine, and it was delicious.
Exploring local cuisine is a highlight of traveling.
The restaurant specializes in local cuisine.

words.definition: Ready-to-eat food or drink sold by a vendor in a street or other public place.
sentences: The night market is famous for its street food.
We enjoyed trying different street food dishes.
Street food is often cheap and tasty.

words.definition: A card with a picture on one side, used for sending messages by mail without an envelope.
sentences: I sent a postcard to my friend.
Let's buy some postcards to send home.
The postcard shows a beautiful sunset.

words.definition: The place where your passport is checked when you enter or leave a country.
sentences: We waited in line at passport control.
Passport control can take a long time.
Have your passport ready for passport control.

words.definition: A system of buses, trains, etc., that is available to everyone.
sentences: We used public transport to get around the city.
Public transport is often cheaper than taxis.
Many cities have excellent public transport systems.

words.definition: A list of the times when buses, trains, or planes arrive and depart.
sentences: Check the timetable for the next train.
The bus timetable is posted at the stop.
We need to follow the flight timetable.

words.definition: A raised area next to a railway track where passengers get on and off trains.
sentences: The train departs from platform 5.
Wait behind the yellow line on the platform.
We met on the train platform.

words.definition: A small vehicle used for carrying luggage, especially at airports.
sentences: Get a luggage cart for your heavy bags.
Luggage carts are available near the entrance.
Push the luggage cart carefully.

words.definition: The main building at an airport where passengers handle their travel procedures.
sentences: Our flight leaves from the international terminal building.
The terminal building has many shops and restaurants.
Follow the signs to the correct terminal building.

words.definition: The area where passengers wait to board a plane or other transport.
sentences: We waited in the boarding area for our flight.
The boarding area was quite crowded.
Find your gate in the boarding area.

words.definition: A business that helps people to plan and book trips.
sentences: We booked our holiday through a travel agency.
The travel agency offered a great package deal.
Visit a travel agency for expert advice.

words.definition: A holiday organized by a travel company that includes travel, accommodation, and sometimes meals and activities.
sentences: We went on a package tour to Egypt.
Package tours are convenient for first-time travelers.
The package tour included all excursions.

words.definition: A holiday or resort where the price includes all meals, drinks, and activities.
sentences: We booked an all-inclusive resort for our honeymoon.
All-inclusive deals are great for budgeting.
The all-inclusive package made our trip stress-free.

words.definition: A hotel rate that includes breakfast and either lunch or dinner.
sentences: Our hotel stay was on a half board basis.
Half board is a good option if you plan to eat out for one meal.
The half board package suited our needs perfectly.

words.definition: A hotel rate that includes breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
sentences: The resort offers full board options.
Full board is convenient for families with children.
We chose full board so we didn't have to worry about meals.

words.definition: A holiday where you stay in accommodation with cooking facilities and prepare your own meals.
sentences: We prefer self-catering holidays to save money.
The self-catering apartment had a fully equipped kitchen.
Self-catering gives you more flexibility with meal times.

words.definition: A house or apartment that you can rent for a holiday.
sentences: We found a beautiful vacation rental near the beach.
Vacation rentals are popular for group travel.
Booking a vacation rental can be cheaper than a hotel.

words.definition: A stay at a private house or apartment, often with a local family, especially for students or tourists.
sentences: I experienced the local culture through a homestay.
Homestay programs are great for language learners.
Our homestay hosts were very welcoming.

words.definition: A private house offering accommodation to paying guests.
sentences: We stayed at a charming guesthouse in the village.
The guesthouse offered a delicious homemade breakfast.
Many guesthouses are family-run businesses.

words.definition: A small, stylish hotel, typically located in a fashionable urban area.
sentences: We stayed at a lovely boutique hotel in the city center.
Boutique hotels offer unique and personalized experiences.
This boutique hotel has a very modern design.

words.definition: Tourism directed towards exotic, often threatened, natural environments, intended to support conservation efforts and observe wildlife.
sentences: Eco-tourism helps protect the environment.
Many travelers are interested in eco-tourism.
The region promotes eco-tourism to preserve its natural beauty.

words.definition: Tourism that respects both local people and the environment, and does not cause damage to either.
sentences: Sustainable tourism aims to minimize negative impacts.
We support companies practicing sustainable tourism.
Sustainable tourism benefits local communities.

words.definition: Traveling or hiking with a backpack.
sentences: They went backpacking across Southeast Asia.
Backpacking is a popular way to travel on a budget.
You need good gear for backpacking.

words.definition: A train ticket that allows unlimited rail travel in certain European countries for a specific period.
sentences: I bought an Interrail pass for my European adventure.
An Interrail pass is great for exploring multiple countries.
Many students use an Interrail pass for summer travel.

words.definition: A train ticket similar to an Interrail pass, but for non-European residents traveling in Europe.
sentences: He used a Eurail pass to travel through Europe.
The Eurail pass offers flexibility for travelers.
Is a Eurail pass suitable for my trip?

words.definition: An online journal where a person writes about their travel experiences.
sentences: She writes a popular travel blog.
I follow several travel blogs for inspiration.
His travel blog has amazing photos.

words.definition: A person who creates video blogs about their travel experiences.
sentences: The travel vlogger shared tips for budget travel.
Many people enjoy watching travel vloggers.
She dreams of becoming a full-time travel vlogger.

words.definition: A tool or person that helps organize the details of a trip, including routes, schedules, and activities.
sentences: I used an online itinerary planner for my trip.
A good itinerary planner saves a lot of time.
She works as a professional itinerary planner.

words.definition: A person who leads tourists, or a book that gives information for tourists.
sentences: Our travel guide was very knowledgeable about the history.
I bought a new travel guide for Japan.
The travel guide helped us discover hidden gems.

words.definition: A journey to a place and back again on the same day.
sentences: We went on a day trip to the countryside.
A day trip is perfect for a quick escape.
The bus offers day trips to the national park.

words.definition: A journey to a place and back again.
sentences: I bought a round trip ticket to New York.
A round trip ticket is usually cheaper than two one-way tickets.
Our round trip journey was very smooth.

words.definition: A journey or ticket that allows you to travel in only one direction.
sentences: I only need a one-way ticket to London.
Is this a one-way street?
One-way flights can sometimes be expensive.

words.definition: A flight that goes from one place to another without stopping.
sentences: We took a direct flight to save time.
Are there any direct flights to Rome?
Direct flights are often more expensive.

words.definition: A flight that allows you to continue your journey after arriving on another flight.
sentences: I have a connecting flight in Frankfurt.
Make sure you have enough time for your connecting flight.
My connecting flight was delayed.

words.definition: A flight that travels a very long distance.
sentences: Long-haul flights can be tiring.
I always try to sleep on long-haul flights.
Prepare for a long-haul flight with entertainment.

words.definition: A flight that travels a short distance.
sentences: Short-haul flights are usually quicker.
Most domestic flights are short-haul.
I prefer short-haul flights for convenience.

words.definition: The cheapest class of seats on an airplane or train.
sentences: We flew economy class to save money.
Economy class seats are usually smaller.
Many airlines offer good service in economy class.

words.definition: A class of seats on an airplane or train that is more expensive than economy class and offers better services.
sentences: He traveled in business class for comfort.
Business class offers more legroom.
The company paid for her business class ticket.

words.definition: The most expensive and luxurious class of seats on an airplane or train.
sentences: First class offers premium service and amenities.
They enjoyed a luxurious journey in first class.
First class tickets are very expensive.

words.definition: When an airline or hotel has sold more tickets or rooms than are available.
sentences: The flight was overbooked, so some passengers were delayed.
Hotels can sometimes be overbooked during peak season.
Being overbooked can be frustrating for travelers.

words.definition: A period of time when you are waiting at an airport for another flight.
sentences: We have a long layover in Dubai.
A short layover is better than a long one.
What can we do during our layover?

words.definition: A document that lists goods brought into a country, which may be subject to duty.
sentences: Fill out the customs declaration form carefully.
You need to complete a customs declaration form upon arrival.
The customs declaration form asks about prohibited items.

words.definition: The place where officials check people entering or leaving a country.
sentences: We passed through border control quickly.
Border control officers checked our visas.
Expect queues at border control during busy times.

words.definition: A business that helps people to plan and book trips.
sentences: We booked our holiday through a travel agency.
The travel agency offered a great package deal.
Visit a travel agency for expert advice.

words.definition: A person whose job is to help people plan and book trips.
sentences: Our travel agent found us a cheap flight.
Consult a travel agent for complex itineraries.
The travel agent gave us good recommendations.

words.definition: A place where tourists can get information about local attractions, accommodation, and transport.
sentences: We picked up a map at the tourist information center.
The tourist information center provides free brochures.
Ask at the tourist information center for events.

words.definition: A person who shows visitors around a specific area and provides information about it.
sentences: We hired a local guide to show us around the ancient ruins.
A local guide can offer unique insights.
The local guide knew all the best spots.

words.definition: The amount of money you have available to spend on a trip.
sentences: We need to stick to our travel budget.
Planning a travel budget helps manage expenses.
Our travel budget was quite limited this year.

words.definition: The cost of something; money spent.
sentences: Accommodation is a major travel expense.
Keep track of your travel expenses.
Food and transport are common expenses.

words.definition: A piece of paper that shows that you have paid for something.
sentences: Keep all your receipts for travel expenses.
Can I have a receipt, please?
The receipt shows the total amount paid.

words.definition: The system by which one country's money is exchanged for another's.
sentences: I need to get some foreign exchange before my trip.
Foreign exchange rates fluctuate daily.
You can get foreign exchange at the bank.

words.definition: A device that allows you to plug electrical appliances into sockets in foreign countries.
sentences: Don't forget your travel adapter for Europe.
A universal travel adapter is very useful.
My phone charger needs a travel adapter.

words.definition: A portable device for charging electronic devices such as mobile phones.
sentences: Bring a power bank to keep your phone charged.
My power bank is fully charged.
A power bank is essential for long journeys.

words.definition: A small pillow shaped to support the neck, often used during travel.
sentences: A neck pillow makes long flights more comfortable.
I always use a neck pillow when I travel.
This neck pillow is very soft.

words.definition: A soft cover worn over the eyes to block out light, especially for sleeping.
sentences: An eye mask helps me sleep on the plane.
Don't forget your eye mask for the overnight journey.
The eye mask blocked out all the light.

words.definition: Small pieces of soft material that you put into your ears to keep out noise.
sentences: Wear earplugs to block out the noise.
Earplugs are useful for sleeping in noisy places.
I always pack earplugs for my travels.

words.definition: A feeling of nausea and dizziness experienced while traveling in a vehicle.
sentences: She gets travel sickness on long bus rides.
Take medication for travel sickness before your journey.
Eating light can help prevent travel sickness.

words.definition: A box containing basic medical supplies for treating minor injuries.
sentences: Always carry a first-aid kit when hiking.
The first-aid kit had bandages and antiseptic wipes.
A small first-aid kit is essential for travel.

words.definition: A cream or lotion that you put on your skin to protect it from the sun.
sentences: Don't forget to apply sunscreen at the beach.
Sunscreen is important to prevent sunburn.
Reapply sunscreen every few hours.

words.definition: A substance that keeps insects away.
sentences: Use insect repellent to avoid mosquito bites.
Insect repellent is crucial in tropical areas.
Spray insect repellent before going outdoors.

words.definition: A small photograph of your face, used for identification in a passport.
sentences: You need two passport photos for the visa application.
Get your passport photos taken professionally.
The passport photo must meet specific requirements.

words.definition: All the papers and tickets needed for a journey.
sentences: Keep all your travel documents in one place.
Make copies of your travel documents.
Ensure all your travel documents are valid.

words.definition: An electronic ticket, especially for an airline flight.
sentences: I received my e-ticket by email.
You can show your e-ticket on your phone.
E-tickets are convenient and paperless.

words.definition: A large display at an airport or station showing departure times and gate numbers.
sentences: Check the departure board for your flight status.
The departure board showed a delay for our flight.
Look for your flight number on the departure board.

words.definition: A place where lost items are kept until they are claimed by their owners.
sentences: I reported my lost wallet at the lost and found.
Check the lost and found for your umbrella.
The airport has a lost and found office.

words.definition: A bus that travels regularly between two places.
sentences: Take the shuttle bus to the hotel.
The airport offers a free shuttle bus service.
The shuttle bus runs every 15 minutes.

words.definition: A car that you pay to use for a short period of time.
sentences: We picked up our rental car at the airport.
A rental car gives you flexibility.
Make sure to return the rental car with a full tank.

words.definition: A small building where you pay money to use a road or bridge.
sentences: Slow down for the toll booth.
We paid the fee at the toll booth.
The toll booth accepts cash and cards.

words.definition: A portable shelter made of cloth, supported by poles and ropes, used for camping.
sentences: We slept in a tent.
Setting up the tent was easy.
Make sure your tent is waterproof.

words.definition: The natural features of a landscape, especially when they are attractive to look at.
sentences: The scenery in the countryside is beautiful.
We enjoyed the breathtaking scenery during our drive.
The region is famous for its stunning scenery.

words.definition: A building or place that is easily recognized, especially one that is important in history.
sentences: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark.
We visited several historical landmarks.
The statue is a well-known landmark in the city.

words.definition: A building where collections of valuable and interesting objects are kept and shown to the public.
sentences: We spent the afternoon at the art museum.
The museum has many ancient artifacts.
Children love visiting interactive museums.

words.definition: A room or building for showing works of art.
sentences: We visited a modern art gallery.
The art gallery displayed paintings by local artists.
Is there an art gallery near here?

words.definition: A place that is important in history.
sentences: Rome has many historical sites.
We learned a lot at the historical site.
Preserving historical sites is important.

words.definition: An area of natural beauty protected by the government for public enjoyment.
sentences: We went camping in a national park.
Yellowstone is a famous national park.
National parks offer many outdoor activities.

words.definition: Animals and plants that live independently of humans, in natural conditions.
sentences: We saw amazing wildlife in the jungle.
Protecting wildlife is important.
The national park is home to diverse wildlife.

words.definition: A place where wild animals are kept for people to look at.
sentences: We took the kids to the zoo.
The zoo has many different animals.
The panda is the most popular animal at the zoo.

words.definition: A building where fish and other water animals are kept and shown to the public.
sentences: We visited the large aquarium in the city.
The aquarium has a huge shark tank.
Children love watching the fish at the aquarium.

words.definition: A large amusement park that is based on a particular subject or subjects.
sentences: Disneyland is a famous theme park.
We spent the whole day at the theme park.
Theme parks offer rides and entertainment.

words.definition: A large outdoor area with rides, games, and other entertainment.
sentences: The amusement park has a big roller coaster.
We had a lot of fun at the amusement park.
Many families visit amusement parks in summer.

words.definition: An amusement park that features water play areas, such as slides and pools.
sentences: The water park is a great place to cool down.
Kids love the slides at the water park.
We spent the afternoon at the water park.

words.definition: A town where many people go for holidays, usually with hotels, restaurants, and entertainment.
sentences: This is a popular resort town for winter sports.
The resort town is always busy during peak season.
Many resort towns are located by the sea.

words.definition: A place where people go to ski, with facilities for skiing and accommodation.
sentences: We went to a ski resort for our winter holiday.
The ski resort has many slopes for all levels.
The ski resort offers equipment rental.

words.definition: A resort located on or near a beach.
sentences: We stayed at a beautiful beach resort.
The beach resort offers water sports.
Many beach resorts have private beaches.

words.definition: A resort located in a mountainous area.
sentences: The mountain resort is perfect for hiking.
We enjoyed the fresh air at the mountain resort.
The mountain resort offers stunning views.
